node.title: Foo Fighters Pull Out of MN Show Hours After Announcing Tour Due to Lack of COVID Measures
node.alt: The Foo Fighters pulled out of their show in Minneapolis after the venue refused to implement the band's COVID-19 safety measures. Above, Dave Grohl of honorees Foo Fighters performs onstage during the 2021 MTV Video Music Awards at Barclays Center on September 12, 2021, in the Brooklyn borough of New York City.
node.description: The show scheduled for August 3, 2022, at Huntington Bank Stadium was the band's only tour stop in Minnesota.
node.content:
["Hours after announcing their 2022 tour dates, the Foo Fighters pulled out of the band's show in Minneapolis, citing the venue's failure to implement COVID-19 safety measures.", "\"Due to Huntington Bank Stadium's refusal to agree to the band's Covid safety measures, Foo Fighters are unable to perform at that venue,\" the band wrote in a Tuesday statement. \"We apologize for any inconvenience and are working on finding a suitable replacement\u2014one that will prioritize the health and safety of everyone working and attending the show.\"", "The show scheduled for August 3, 2022, at Huntington Bank Stadium was the Foo Fighters' only tour stop in Minnesota.", "Huntington Bank Stadium has not required patrons to wear masks, provide proof of vaccination or a negative COVID test in order to attend events at the venue, including this season's University of Minnesota Gophers football games.", "", "
The Foo Fighters pulled out of their show in Minneapolis after the venue refused to implement the band's COVID-19 safety measures. Above, Dave Grohl of honorees Foo Fighters performs onstage during the 2021 MTV Video Music Awards at Barclays Center on September 12, 2021, in the Brooklyn borough of New York City.
", "On Tuesday, the band announced 17 dates across North America, including two in Canada, as part of the Foo Fighters' 27th anniversary tour.", "This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available."]
